title: 115_hr5089
content: The Act may be cited as the "Strengthening Local Transportation Security Capabilities Act of 2018". Definitions are provided in Section 2. The Act defines "public and private sector stakeholders" and "surface transportation asset" as facilities, equipment, or systems used by public transportation agencies, railroad carriers, or entities offering scheduled services. The Act defines "transportation facility" as a bus terminal, rail station, airport, or other facilities determined by the Secretary of Homeland Security. SEC. 3. THREAT INFORMATION SHARING. The Secretary of Homeland Security will prioritize assigning officers and intelligence analysts to high-risk surface transportation asset locations with participating fusion centers to enhance security by sharing classified information on terrorist threats. Assigned personnel will generate and share transportation security intelligence products focusing on terrorist threats. The Secretary of Homeland Security aims to assist law enforcement agencies in efficiently deploying resources to detect, prevent, and respond to terrorist threats to surface transportation assets. This includes promoting sharing of threat information among jurisdictions and enhancing situational awareness of such threats. The Secretary will provide classified information to owners and operators of surface transportation assets to foster greater sharing of intelligence related to terrorist threats. The Secretary of Homeland Security aims to assist law enforcement agencies in detecting, preventing, and responding to terrorist threats to surface transportation assets by providing security clearances for classified national security information programs. SEC. 4. INTEGRATED AND UNIFIED OPERATIONS CENTERS. The Administrator of the Transportation Security Administration will establish an integrated and unified operations center for overseeing daily operations of transportation facilities to coordinate responses to terrorism and other incidents. A framework will be provided to stakeholders within 120 days, and a report will be submitted to relevant committees within 1 year. The Senate is discussing the establishment of integrated and unified operations centers at transportation facilities with the presence of the Transportation Security Administration. SEC. 5. LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT SECURITY TRAINING. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with stakeholders, may develop a training program through the Federal Law Enforcement Training Centers to enhance law enforcement agencies' capabilities in responding to terrorism and serious incidents at surface transportation assets. The program must include tactical instruction based on current terrorist tactics and prioritize training for eligible agencies receiving grants. Eligible agencies receiving grants under sections 2003 or 2004 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 604 and 605). Officers employed by railroad carriers operating passenger service, including interstate service. Passed by the House of Representatives on March 22, 2018. Signed by Karen L. Haas, Clerk.
